disclaimer.title: About this app
disclaimer.text: This app supports emotional self-awareness. It is not a diagnostic tool and does not replace professional mental health support. If you are experiencing distress, please reach out to a qualified professional.
disclaimer.label: Disclaimer

onboarding.screen1Title: This is an exploration, not a test
onboarding.screen1Body: There are no right or wrong answers. Emotions are complex and layered. Take your time — this is a space for curiosity, not judgment.
onboarding.screen1BodySimple: There is no right or wrong answer. Be curious, not harsh with yourself.
onboarding.screen2Body: No emotion is good or bad. Anger protects boundaries. Sadness helps process loss. Fear keeps you safe. Instead of asking "what's wrong," ask "what is my body telling me?"
onboarding.screen2BodySimple: Each emotion has a job. None are bad. Ask: what is this feeling trying to tell me?
onboarding.screen3Body: Body Map — feel where emotions live in your body. Emotion Wheel — navigate from general to specific feelings. Plutchik — discover how emotions combine and interact. Each reveals different aspects. Start wherever feels natural.
onboarding.screen3BodySimple: Body Map: start with sensations. Emotion Wheel: choose feeling words. Plutchik: see emotion combinations. Pick what feels easiest.
onboarding.screen4Body: This app supports emotional self-awareness. It is not a diagnostic tool and does not replace professional mental health support. If you ever want to talk to someone, you can call 116 123 (Romania, free, 24/7) or visit findahelpline.com.
onboarding.screen4BodySimple: This app helps you notice emotions. It is not medical diagnosis. If you need support, call 116 123 or visit findahelpline.com.

dontKnow.normalization: Many people find it hard to name what they feel — this is normal and a skill that develops with practice.

somatic.guidedStart: Take a breath. Notice your body.
somatic.guidedPrompt: What do you notice in your {region}?
somatic.guidedTraumaNote: If any area feels uncomfortable, you can skip it at any time.
somatic.guidedNothingNormal: Not noticing sensations is common. Body awareness develops with practice.
somatic.interoceptionTip: Body awareness is like a muscle — it develops with practice. Try placing your hand on your stomach and just noticing the temperature.
somatic.interoceptionTip2: You can practice noticing sensations during everyday activities: the warmth of a cup, the weight of your feet on the floor.
somatic.interoceptionTip3: If nothing comes up, that's okay. Sometimes the signal is 'neutral' — and noticing neutral is also body awareness.
somatic.guidedPause: You noticed strong {sensation} in your {region}. Take a breath before continuing.
somatic.numbnessFlooding: Your body may be protecting you right now. Would you like to try a grounding exercise before continuing?

privacy.headline: Your emotional life is deeply personal. That's why Emot-ID keeps everything on your device.
privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.detail: All your data — emotion selections, session history, body maps, and preferences — is stored locally on your device using IndexedDB and localStorage. Nothing is sent to any server. There are no analytics, no accounts, and no cloud sync. You can delete all data anytime from Past Sessions.
